doc.repnme: Transcript of meeting of the Executive Directors of the IDA held on December 29, 1964
doc.abstracts: This is a meeting of the Executive Directors of International Development Association (IDA) to recommendation on a development credit to Nigeria for a school construction and equipment project. The Bank has made loans to Nigeria totaling $153.5 million. Over the past three years of so several Banks economic reports have advocated the blending of no-conventional finance with conventional finance for Nigeria, in order to erase the burden of debt service that would otherwise be incurred as Nigeria took more and more loans for its development needs. The IDA credit for education now will help to finance construction of school in each of the regional subdivisions of Nigeria, and in the Federal territory. Under the constitution the Federal Government is the only government with the right to borrow externally.
